title: Provides for accountability and disclosure of county, town or village acquisition of land for open space, environmental and/or historic preservation purposes
summary: Requires the chief executive of any county, town or village which acquires an interest in land for open space, environmental and/or historic preservation purposes or park purposes, to make certain findings as to the need for such acquisition for such purposes, and such findings and documents relating thereto shall be filed with the respective county clerk, town clerk or village clerk and made available to the public for not less than 90 days.

       AN ACT to amend the  environmental  conservation  law,  in  relation  to
         accountability  and special disclosure in state authorized or assisted
         county, town or village acquisition of land for open  space,  environ-
         mental and/or historic preservation

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative declaration.  Through  authorizations  to  tax,
    2  incur  debt,  and  appropriation of state funds for the purposes of open
    3  space acquisition, the state has facilitated the  ability  of  counties,
    4  towns  and  villages  to finance open space acquisition.  The process of
    5  open space acquisition is complex and susceptible to questions of  fair-
    6  ness and appropriateness in instances of particular public land acquisi-
    7  tions.  Therefore,  the legislature declares its intention to provide in
    8  this act for accountability and special disclosure for open space acqui-
    9  sition transactions authorized or assisted by the state.
   10    S 2. The environmental conservation law is amended  by  adding  a  new
   11  section 49-0212 to read as follows:
   12  S  49-0212.  ACCOUNTABILITY  AND  SPECIAL  DISCLOSURE IN COUNTY, TOWN OR
   13                VILLAGE OPEN SPACE TRANSACTIONS.
   14    1. THE COUNTY EXECUTIVE, TOWN SUPERVISOR,  MAYOR  OR  CHIEF  EXECUTIVE
   15  OFFICER  OF  ANY  COUNTY, TOWN OR VILLAGE WHICH PURCHASES AN INTEREST IN
   16  LAND FOR OPEN SPACE, ENVIRONMENTAL AND/OR HISTORIC PRESERVATION PURPOSES
   17  OR PARK PURPOSES SHALL SIGN A FINDING (HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO  IN  THIS
   18  SECTION  AS THE "FINDING") AS PROVIDED FOR IN THIS SECTION FOR EACH SUCH
   19  TRANSACTION IN WHICH THE RESPECTIVE COUNTY, TOWN OR VILLAGE IS A  PARTY.
   20  SUCH FINDING SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, THE FOLLOWING:
   21    A.  THAT  THE  LAND  OR  EASEMENT ACQUIRED IS SUITABLE FOR OPEN SPACE,
   22  ENVIRONMENTAL AND/OR HISTORIC PRESERVATION PURPOSES AND CONSISTENT  WITH

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06077-01-1

       A. 4125                             2

    1  THE COUNTY'S, TOWN'S OR VILLAGE'S OPEN SPACE, ENVIRONMENTAL AND HISTORIC
    2  PRESERVATION PRESERVATION POLICY AND PUBLIC NEED;
    3    B.  THAT  THE LAND ACQUISITION PROCESS WAS COMPLETE AND FAIR INCLUDING
    4  THE USE OF AN INDEPENDENT  PROFESSIONAL  APPRAISER  IN  DETERMINING  THE
    5  VALUE  OF  THE  LAND  OR EASEMENT, OR, WHERE AN INDEPENDENT PROFESSIONAL
    6  APPRAISER WAS NOT USED, THE REASON THEREFOR;
    7    C. THAT IN THE CASE OF A PURCHASE, WHERE THE  PURCHASE  PRICE  EXCEEDS
    8  THE  APPRAISED  VALUE  AS DETERMINED BY THE APPRAISAL, WHY SUCH PURCHASE
    9  PRICE IS IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST; AND
   10    D. THAT ALL COUNTY, TOWN OR VILLAGE LAWS AND PROCEDURES REGARDING LAND
   11  ACQUISITIONS HAVE BEEN FULLY FOLLOWED AND DOCUMENTED, INCLUDING A LOG OF
   12  ALL CONVERSATIONS RELATING TO THE TRANSACTION AND ALL INFORMATION ON THE
   13  COUNTY'S, TOWN'S OR VILLAGE'S ACQUISITION ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
   14    SUCH FINDING SHALL BE SIGNED AND FILED  WITH  THE  APPROPRIATE  COUNTY
   15  CLERK,  TOWN  CLERK OR VILLAGE CLERK NOT LATER THAN SEVEN DAYS AFTER THE
   16  ACQUISITION TRANSACTION SHALL HAVE BEEN DEEMED TO BE COMPLETE.
   17    2. IN ADDITION TO THE OTHER PROVISIONS FOR MAINTENANCE AND AVAILABILI-
   18  TY OF PUBLIC RECORDS AND UPON COMPLETION OF AN OPEN SPACE LAND OR  EASE-
   19  MENT  TRANSACTION COVERED BY THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION, A FILE WITH
   20  ALL RECORDS  AND  INFORMATION  RELATING  TO  THE  TRANSACTION  INCLUDING
   21  APPRAISALS,  NOTES,  INTERNAL  MEMORANDA  AND  ALL  OTHER CORRESPONDENCE
   22  RELATING THERETO SHALL BE READILY AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AT THE
   23  APPROPRIATE COUNTY, TOWN OR VILLAGE CLERK'S OFFICE  FOR  NOT  LESS  THAN
   24  NINETY DAYS FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE TRANSACTION.
   25    3.  THE  APPROPRIATE  COUNTY  CLERK, TOWN CLERK OR VILLAGE CLERK SHALL
   26  PUBLISH IN THE NEWSPAPER OF RECORD FOR THE RESPECTIVE  COUNTY,  TOWN  OR
   27  VILLAGE  A  NOTICE  OF EACH ACQUISITION TRANSACTION WITHIN SEVEN DAYS OF
   28  THE FILING OF THE FINDING. SUCH NOTICE SHALL STATE THAT INFORMATION  AND
   29  RECORDS ON SUCH TRANSACTION ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT THE OFFICE OF
   30  THE RESPECTIVE COUNTY CLERK, TOWN CLERK OR VILLAGE CLERK.
   31    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
   32  have become a law.
